editAgentRounds.reply:
You said "resume" — I can continue whatever you were doing, but I need one quick clarification so I resume the right thing.

Plan: I’ll confirm what you want resumed, then pick the appropriate actions (e.g., reopen last file, continue an edit, run the server, re-run tests/build). Pick one of the options below or describe what you meant.

Checklist — choose one:
- Resume editing: re-open the last modified project file(s) and continue changes.
- Resume build/run: start the app (Tomcat) or run the project's build (compile.bat / COMPILE_AND_DEPLOY.bat).
- Resume tests: run unit/integration tests and show failures.
- Resume debugging: attach to the running Tomcat or rerun the last failing scenario.
- Resume Git work: show `git status`, last commits, or continue a merge/rebase.
- Other (please describe).

If you don't pick, I’ll by default: show recent git status and the last 5 modified files in the repo so you can tell me which work to resume.

Which option should I resume?
